N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 139.4 - Application for approval to appoint above the minimum

State Regulations

An application for approval to appoint under this Part shall
be made by the appointing officer to the Director of Classification and

Compensation. Such application shall: (a) indicate the salary rate at which
appointment is requested; (b) identify the eligible list, if any, from which appointment would be
made; (c) include satisfactory
evidence that the person for whom approval is sought has qualifications as
indicated in section
139.2
of this Part; (d) provide reasons why the person for whom
approval is sought will not accept appointment at the minimum salary and why
his appointment at a higher rate is in the interest of State service; (e) list the total number of positions in
such title within the department or agency and the names, current salary rates, and qualifications of incumbent State employees entitled to equivalent salary
treatment as specified in section
139.5
of this Part; (f) furnish such other information as may be
required by the Director of Classification and Compensation. Notes
